info.title: Product Content
info.description: MedsAPI Product Content provides endpoints to retrieve current and accurate evidence-based content. The documentation on this site covers all supported functionality of the MedsAPI suite of APIs. Any fields or parameters not represented by the documentation are unsupported and subject to change. Additional optional query parameters and fields in the response could be added in the future as a non breaking change. Any other change that could break the contract would be considered in a future version.

refresh_token_expires_in.description: The number of seconds remaining before the refresh token will expire.  The lifespan of refresh tokens is usually larger than Access tokens. The exact duration depends on the type of Refresh Tokens issued. The different types explained below in the document.

developer.email.description: Name of the owener of the token

token_type.description: Always set to be a bearer token

issued_at.description: Epoch time when the token was issued

client_id.description: Client Id that the token can be used by

application_name.description: Id of the application that is registered for this token

expires_in.description: Seconds until this token has expired

refresh_count.description: When this token can be refreshed automatically

status.description: Indicates that the token has been approved

401.description: Unauthorized - This request requires authentication and none was provided.

403.description: Forbidden - The authentication credentials do not have access to this resource.

404.description: Not Found - The server was unable to find a resource matching this request.

405.description: Method Not Allowed - The server has not implemented the requested HTTP method.

406.description: Not Acceptable - The server cannot return the requested media type.

415.description: Unsupported Media Type - The server cannot understand the media type in this request.

429.description: Too Many Requests - The client has sent too many requests within the given time.

500.description: Internal Server Error - There was an unexpected error with the server

product.description: Requesting an article from all MedsAPI content

client_id.description: The client_id to use will be provided by EBSCO

client_secret.description: This will be provided by EBSCO

post.description: The authentication endpoint for getting a token, used in all other Product Content APIs.

get.description: Additional Documentation [/articles/{articleId}](https://developer.ebsco.com/medical-point-care-apis/product-content/docs). See also the documentation for the /articles/{articleId} endpoint for each MedsAPI product for more specific information on the fields.

get.summary: GET a list of articles and metadata that have been updated
get.description: Return list of updated articles within a given range

parameters.name: updatedSince
parameters.description: Return article metadata starting at this UTC date. Must be formatted in ISO_8601 standards: YYYY-MM-DD time is optional

parameters.name: updatedBefore
parameters.description: Return article metdata ending at this UTC date. Must be formatted in ISO_8601 standards: YYYY-MM-DD time is optional

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: Next page of items to return

metadata.description: Information available about the article (not all fields shown; see the product /articles/{articleId} for more fields to expect for each product)

DC.Coverage.description: The spatial or temporal topic of the resource, spatial applicability of the resource, or jurisdiction under which the resource is relevant.

DC.Date.Revised.description: Date when the article was last revised.

DC.Format.description: The file format, physical medium, or dimensions of the resource.

DC.Identifier.description: The unambiguous reference to the resource within a given context.

DC.Publisher.description: The organization responsible for making the resource available.

DC.Title.description: The name given to the resource.

DC.Type.description: The nature or genre of the resource.

DC.rights.owner.description: Name of the holder of the copyright.

abstract.example: Acne is a chronic skin condition characterized by noninflammatory open and/or closed comedones and inflammatory lesions.

description.example: Acne is a chronic skin condition characterized by noninflammatory open and/or closed comedones and inflammatory lesions.

children.description: Child section(s), which can also have children.

title.description: References referred to in this article

data.example: Tartaglia NR . A review of trisomy X. Orphanet J Rare Dis. 2010;5:8.

tableContent.description: A list of HTML table contents, referenced by their anchor.

abstract.description: An abstract may be found in NAH Reference Center articles
abstract.example: SYNOPSIS OF FACTS: Plaintiff, female, 38, had periodontal surgery on her two upper right molar teeth performed by Dr. Wright, periodontist. Plaintiff then had difficulty eating because she could not open her jaw which was painful. Dr. Wright prescribed penicillin and referred plaintiff to a chiropractor. This did not work, so 3 days later defendant sent her to a temporomandibular disorder dental specialist. The latter referred her to an oral surgeon who drained 40cc of pus and diagnosed supra-temporal fossa infection of the jaw with only a 5mm jaw opening.

checklist.description: A checklist may be found in Dynamic Health articles

description.example: Acne is a chronic skin condition characterized by noninflammatory open and/or closed comedones and inflammatory lesions.

glossary.description: A glossary may be found in Dynamic Health articles

copyright.example: Copyright 2023, Luke Danaher. Video courtesy of Luke Danaher and Radiopaedia.org. Used under licence.

description.example: Diagnostic Approach to Cystic Lung Disease

href.description: Link to the image, video or poster for the video

posterSize.description: Size of the poster for the video

navigationGroup.description: A navigationGroup may be found in Consumer Health articles

productionInformation.description: A productionInformation may be found in Consumer Health articles

publisher.example: Patient Education Reference Center, EBSCO Publishing

supplemental.description: A supplemental section may be found in Dynamic Health articles

videoIds.description: List of video Ids in the article

content.description: The content shown in the body of the article containing a link to a dialog.

dialog.description: HTML content to display inthe dialog

standAlone.description: Indicates if table can stand independent of the article

parentSection.description: Section the table is shown in

text.example: Heart Failure Society of America guideline on heart failure epidemiology...

practiceChangingUpdate.description: Indicates if this update cause a practice change.

healthEquity.description: Indicates if this update indicates a change to health equity

anchor.description: Location in the atrticle of the update

links.description: HATEOAS links for self, previous, next, first, last as available.

rel.description: Relationship of the link and the current page of results.

totalItems.description: Total number of items that match the query.

items.description: A list of all items matching the search request.

slug.description: Slug for the article, when available

updatedAt.description: When the article was last modified

addedToListAt.description: When the article was made available to your account

removedFromListAt.description: When the article was removed from your account

isDeleted.description: When true, the article has been removed from EBSCO systems

conflictsText.example: Dr. Elpern declares no relevant conflicts of\n interest.
